title: Esther Chapter 10 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Esther chapter 10 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Esther Chapter 10 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Esther Chapter 10.

questions.question: What did King Ahasuerus lay upon the land and the isles of the sea?
questions.correctAnswer: A tribute
questions.explanation: Esther 10:1 states that King Ahasuerus laid a tribute upon the land and the isles of the sea.

questions.question: Where are the acts of King Ahasuerus's power and the greatness of Mordecai recorded?
options: In the book of the chronicles of the kings of Media and Persia
In the book of Esther only
questions.correctAnswer: In the book of the chronicles of the kings of Media and Persia
questions.explanation: Esther 10:2 mentions that the acts of the king’s power and the greatness of Mordecai are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Media and Persia.

questions.question: Who was next unto King Ahasuerus according to Esther 10?
questions.correctAnswer: Mordecai the Jew
questions.explanation: Esther 10:3 states that Mordecai the Jew was next unto King Ahasuerus.

questions.question: What did Mordecai seek for his people?
questions.correctAnswer: The wealth of his people
questions.explanation: Esther 10:3 explains that Mordecai sought the wealth of his people and spoke peace to all his seed.

questions.question: Who said, 'God hath done these things'?
questions.correctAnswer: Mordecai
questions.explanation: Esther 10:4 records the statement 'God hath done these things' as said by Mordecai.

questions.question: What did Mordecai remember according to Esther 10?
questions.correctAnswer: A dream concerning these matters
questions.explanation: Esther 10:5 mentions that Mordecai remembered a dream he saw concerning these matters.

questions.question: In the dream mentioned in Esther 10, what did the little fountain become?
questions.correctAnswer: A river
questions.explanation: Esther 10:6 says a little fountain became a river, relating it to Esther whom the king married.

questions.question: Who are described as the two dragons in the dream?
questions.correctAnswer: Mordecai and Aman
questions.explanation: Esther 10:7 states that the two dragons are Mordecai and Aman.

questions.question: What were the nations assembled to do?
options: Destroy the name of the Jews
questions.correctAnswer: Destroy the name of the Jews
questions.explanation: Esther 10:8 explains that the nations were assembled to destroy the name of the Jews.

questions.question: What did the nation Israel do according to Esther 10?
options: Cried to God and were saved
questions.correctAnswer: Cried to God and were saved
questions.explanation: Esther 10:9 states that Israel cried to God and were saved, and that the Lord delivered His people from all evils.

questions.question: True or False: Esther 10:10 says God made one lot for all the people.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Esther 10:10 says God made two lots: one for the people of God and another for all the Gentiles.

questions.question: True or False: The two lots came at the hour, time, and day of judgment among all nations.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Esther 10:11 confirms that the two lots came at the hour, time, and day of judgment before God among all nations.

questions.question: True or False: God forgot His people and did not justify His inheritance.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Esther 10:12 states that God remembered His people and justified His inheritance.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Esther 10:13: 'Therefore those days shall be unto them in the month _______, the fourteenth and fifteenth day of the same month.'
questions.correctAnswer: Adar
questions.explanation: Esther 10:13 specifies the month as Adar for the days of assembly and joy.

questions.question: According to Esther 10:13, what will the days in the month of Adar be filled with?
options: Assembly, joy, and gladness before God
questions.correctAnswer: Assembly, joy, and gladness before God
questions.explanation: Esther 10:13 describes these days as having an assembly, joy, and gladness before God.

medium.title: Esther Chapter 10 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Esther Chapter 10 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Esther 10:3 teach us about humility and service in leadership?
options: Mordecai sought the wealth of his people and spoke peace to all his seed
Mordecai demanded honors and riches for himself
Mordecai ignored the needs of his people
Mordecai only cared for his own interests
questions.correctAnswer: Mordecai sought the wealth of his people and spoke peace to all his seed
questions.explanation: Esther 10:3 shows Mordecai as a servant leader who cares for his community's wellbeing by seeking their wealth and peace, teaching humility and selfless service in leadership.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with trusting God's plan. Based on Esther 10:4-5, what biblical truth would you share?
options: God is sovereign and fulfills His promises, even when we do not see it immediately
We must rely solely on our own efforts for success
God does not intervene in human affairs
Dreams are meaningless and should be ignored
questions.correctAnswer: God is sovereign and fulfills His promises, even when we do not see it immediately
questions.explanation: Esther 10:4-5 records Mordecai acknowledging that God has done these things and that his dream concerning these matters has not failed, emphasizing God's sovereignty and faithfulness.

questions.question: According to Esther 10:1, what responsibility did King Ahasuerus have toward the land and the isles of the sea?
options: He laid a tribute upon the land and the isles of the sea
He ignored the needs of the people
He gave away all the land to neighboring nations
questions.correctAnswer: He laid a tribute upon the land and the isles of the sea
questions.explanation: Esther 10:1 states that King Ahasuerus imposed tribute, showing responsibility in governance and stewardship over his kingdom's resources.

questions.question: How can Esther 10:12 encourage believers facing discouragement about God's remembrance of them?
options: God remembers His people and justifies His inheritance
We are on our own in times of trouble
questions.correctAnswer: God remembers His people and justifies His inheritance
questions.explanation: Esther 10:12 reassures believers that God does not forget His people but justifies and cares for His chosen ones, encouraging trust and perseverance.

questions.question: How does the chapter illustrate the value of prayer and dependence on God in spiritual battles?
options: The nation Israel cried to God and was saved from evil
The Jews fought and defeated enemies by themselves
Mordecai relied on political power alone
The king ruled without seeking God's guidance
questions.correctAnswer: The nation Israel cried to God and was saved from evil
questions.explanation: Esther 10:9 highlights that Israel cried out to God and was delivered, emphasizing the power of prayer and reliance on God in facing trials.

questions.question: A believer is struggling to forgive enemies. What insight does Esther 10:7-8 provide about dealing with adversaries?
options: Recognize spiritual battles behind opposition and trust God's deliverance
questions.correctAnswer: Recognize spiritual battles behind opposition and trust God's deliverance
questions.explanation: Verses 7-8 reveal spiritual forces symbolized by dragons and nations assembled against the Jews, teaching believers to rely on God’s power rather than personal vengeance.

questions.question: What does Esther 10:6 teach about the importance of godly marriage and its impact on the community?
options: Esther became queen, symbolizing blessing and light for the people
The king married for political gain only
questions.correctAnswer: Esther became queen, symbolizing blessing and light for the people
questions.explanation: Esther 10:6 uses the metaphor of a river bringing light to describe Esther’s role as queen, illustrating how godly marriage can bring blessing and hope to others.

questions.question: True or False: According to Esther 10:2, the acts of King Ahasuerus and Mordecai’s greatness are recorded in the chronicles of the kings of Media and Persia.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 2 confirms that the acts of the king and Mordecai’s advancement are documented in the official royal chronicles, showing the importance of integrity and record-keeping.

questions.question: True or False: Esther 10:13 indicates that the days of Adar are to be celebrated with sorrow and fasting.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Esther 10:13 specifies that the fourteenth and fifteenth days of Adar are to be celebrated with assembly, joy, gladness, and thanksgiving, not sorrow.

questions.question: How does Esther 10:10-11 teach about God's judgment and the division between peoples?
options: God appointed two lots, one for His people and another for the Gentiles, at the appointed time of judgment
All nations are treated the same without distinction
There is no accountability before God
questions.correctAnswer: God appointed two lots, one for His people and another for the Gentiles, at the appointed time of judgment
questions.explanation: Verses 10-11 explain God’s sovereign judgment dividing peoples according to His purposes, reminding believers to live with integrity and faithfulness.

questions.question: A believer is feeling discouraged about serving others. How does Mordecai’s example in Esther 10:3 encourage perseverance in serving the community?
options: Mordecai was accepted by his brethren because he sought their wealth and peace
Mordecai ignored the needs of others
questions.correctAnswer: Mordecai was accepted by his brethren because he sought their wealth and peace
questions.explanation: Esther 10:3 shows Mordecai’s dedication to the welfare of his people, teaching believers that faithful service leads to acceptance and blessing.

questions.question: How does Esther 10:9 encourage believers about God’s power compared to other nations?
options: God has wrought signs and wonders not done among the Gentiles
God is powerless compared to other gods
All nations have equal miraculous works
questions.correctAnswer: God has wrought signs and wonders not done among the Gentiles
questions.explanation: Verse 9 emphasizes God’s unique power in delivering His people and performing wonders, encouraging believers to trust in His unmatched might.

questions.question: How does the tribute imposed by King Ahasuerus in Esther 10:1 relate to stewardship and responsibility?
options: It shows the king’s role in managing resources for the kingdom’s good
It was a burden ignored by the king
It was meant only for personal gain
questions.correctAnswer: It shows the king’s role in managing resources for the kingdom’s good
questions.explanation: Esther 10:1 explains the tribute as an act of governance, reminding believers about faithful stewardship and ethical responsibility in work and leadership.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Esther 10:13 says those days shall be unto them in the month _____, the fourteenth and fifteenth day of the same month, with an assembly, and joy, and with gladness.
questions.correctAnswer: Adar
questions.explanation: Esther 10:13 specifies the month of Adar for the joyful assembly and celebration, showing the importance of remembering God's deliverance annually.

questions.question: Based on Esther 10:4-5, what attitude should believers have toward God's work in their lives?
options: Recognize and give glory to God for all accomplishments
Claim all success as their own
questions.correctAnswer: Recognize and give glory to God for all accomplishments
questions.explanation: Mordecai states 'God hath done these things' and recalls his dream, teaching believers to acknowledge God's hand in all outcomes (Esther 10:4-5).

hard.title: Esther Chapter 10 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Esther Chapter 10.

questions.question: What tribute did King Ahasuerus lay upon the land and the isles of the sea?
questions.correctAnswer: A tribute
questions.explanation: Esther 10:1 states that King Ahasuerus laid a tribute upon the land and upon the isles of the sea, indicating a form of taxation or levy.

questions.question: According to Esther 10:2, where are the acts of King Ahasuerus and the greatness of Mordecai recorded?
options: In the book of the chronicles of the kings of Media and Persia
In the scrolls of the temple in Jerusalem
In the writings of the prophets
questions.correctAnswer: In the book of the chronicles of the kings of Media and Persia
questions.explanation: The verse mentions that the acts of the king and Mordecai's greatness are written in the chronicles of the kings of Media and Persia, linking the narrative to historical records.

questions.question: What position did Mordecai hold in relation to King Ahasuerus, as described in Esther 10:3?
options: He was next unto king Ahasuerus
questions.correctAnswer: He was next unto king Ahasuerus
questions.explanation: Esther 10:3 explicitly states that Mordecai the Jew was next unto King Ahasuerus, indicating a high position of authority and influence.

questions.question: In Esther 10:3, Mordecai is described as being accepted by whom?
questions.correctAnswer: The multitude of his brethren
questions.explanation: The verse states Mordecai was accepted by the multitude of his brethren, referring to the Jewish people who regarded him highly.

questions.question: What does Mordecai attribute the events to in Esther 10:4?
questions.correctAnswer: God hath done these things
questions.explanation: Mordecai acknowledges divine intervention by stating 'God hath done these things,' highlighting the theological theme of God's sovereignty.

questions.question: What symbol does the 'little fountain became a river' represent in Esther 10:6?
options: Esther, whom the king married and made queen
questions.correctAnswer: Esther, whom the king married and made queen
questions.explanation: Esther 10:6 uses typology, where the river symbolizes Esther’s rise to queenship and the spread of influence through her position.

questions.question: In Esther 10:7, who are identified as the 'two dragons'?
questions.correctAnswer: Mordecai and Aman
questions.explanation: The verse presents a symbolic dualism where Mordecai and Aman are the two dragons, representing opposing forces in the narrative.

questions.question: What do the 'nations' represent in Esther 10:8?
options: Those assembled to destroy the name of the Jews
questions.correctAnswer: Those assembled to destroy the name of the Jews
questions.explanation: Verse 8 clearly identifies the nations as those who sought to destroy the Jewish people, emphasizing the theme of conflict.

questions.question: According to Esther 10:9, why was Israel saved?
options: Because the Lord saved his people and wrought signs and wonders
questions.correctAnswer: Because the Lord saved his people and wrought signs and wonders
questions.explanation: The verse highlights divine salvation and miraculous signs, underscoring God’s active role in delivering Israel.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'two lots' mentioned in Esther 10:10?
options: One for the people of God and another for all the Gentiles
questions.correctAnswer: One for the people of God and another for all the Gentiles
questions.explanation: The two lots symbolize a division of fate or judgment, reflecting the Purim festival’s origin and the dichotomy between Jews and Gentiles.

questions.question: Esther 10:11 describes the 'two lots' coming at a specific time. What is the nature of this timing?
options: The hour, time, and day of judgment before God among all nations
The beginning of the harvest season
questions.correctAnswer: The hour, time, and day of judgment before God among all nations
questions.explanation: The verse emphasizes divine timing and judgment, connecting the lots with God’s sovereign decision-making.

questions.question: What does God do for His people in Esther 10:12?
options: God remembered His people and justified His inheritance
questions.correctAnswer: God remembered His people and justified His inheritance
questions.explanation: This verse affirms God's faithfulness and justice in remembering and vindicating His covenant people.

questions.question: According to Esther 10:13, what days are established for the Jewish people to assemble with joy and gladness?
options: The fourteenth and fifteenth day of the month Adar
The first and second day of Nisan
The tenth and eleventh day of Tishrei
The twenty-fifth and twenty-sixth day of Kislev
questions.correctAnswer: The fourteenth and fifteenth day of the month Adar
questions.explanation: These days correspond to the festival of Purim, commemorating deliverance and celebration among the Jewish people.

questions.question: The events described in Esther 10 reflect a typology of which New Testament theme?
options: God’s deliverance of His people through a mediator
The establishment of the kingdom of heaven
questions.correctAnswer: God’s deliverance of His people through a mediator
questions.explanation: Esther’s queenship and Mordecai’s role foreshadow Christ as mediator delivering His people, a typological connection across Scripture.

questions.question: True or False: Esther 10 explicitly records the author’s intent to affirm God’s providential care over Israel despite the absence of direct mention of God in earlier chapters.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Though earlier chapters do not mention God directly, Esther 10:4 and subsequent verses affirm God’s active role, revealing authorial intent to highlight divine providence.

theological.title: Esther Chapter 10 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Esther Chapter 10 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What tribute did King Ahasuerus lay according to Esther 10:1, and what does this signify in the context of God's sovereign rule?
options: A tribute upon the land and the isles of the sea
A tribute only upon the city of Susa
A tribute upon the people of Israel only
questions.correctAnswer: A tribute upon the land and the isles of the sea
questions.explanation: Esther 10:1 states the king laid a tribute upon the land and the isles of the sea, indicating God's sovereign rule over all nations, as supported by Psalm 24:1, Daniel 4:35, Romans 13:1, and Revelation 17:18.

questions.question: How is Mordecai described in relation to King Ahasuerus and his people in Esther 10:3?
options: Next unto the king, great among the Jews, accepted by his brethren
A distant advisor with no influence
questions.correctAnswer: Next unto the king, great among the Jews, accepted by his brethren
questions.explanation: Esther 10:3 describes Mordecai as next to King Ahasuerus, great among the Jews, and accepted by his brethren, reflecting God's providential elevation of His people, consistent with Exodus 3:12, 2 Samuel 7:14, Romans 8:28, and 1 Peter 2:9.

questions.question: What is Mordecai's attitude toward the events that took place, as stated in Esther 10:4?
questions.correctAnswer: God hath done these things
questions.explanation: Esther 10:4 shows Mordecai attributing the events to God's providence, affirming divine sovereignty in history, which aligns with Isaiah 46:10, Proverbs 19:21, Acts 17:26, and Ephesians 1:11.

questions.question: In Esther 10:6, what does the 'little fountain' that became a river symbolize?
options: Esther, whom the king married and made queen
questions.correctAnswer: Esther, whom the king married and made queen
questions.explanation: Verse 6 uses the image of a little fountain becoming a river to symbolize Esther's rise to queen, a typological foreshadowing of Christ's exaltation, supported by Isaiah 55:1, John 4:14, Revelation 22:1, and Psalm 46:4.

questions.question: Who are represented by the 'two dragons' in Esther 10:7?
questions.correctAnswer: Mordecai and Aman
questions.explanation: Esther 10:7 identifies the two dragons as Mordecai and Aman, symbolizing opposing spiritual forces, which echoes imagery in Daniel 7:3-7, Revelation 12:3-4, Psalm 91:13, and Ezekiel 29:3.

questions.question: According to Esther 10:9, what has the Lord done for Israel?
options: Saved His people and wrought signs and wonders
Made no distinction between them and Gentiles
questions.correctAnswer: Saved His people and wrought signs and wonders
questions.explanation: Esther 10:9 declares that the Lord saved Israel and performed signs and wonders, affirming God's covenant faithfulness, consistent with Exodus 14:30, Psalm 77:14, Acts 7:36, and Hebrews 2:4.

questions.question: What are the 'two lots' mentioned in Esther 10:10, and what theological significance do they hold?
options: One for the people of God, one for all the Gentiles
Two lots for the kings of Media and Persia
Two lots for the priests and Levites
Two lots for the morning and evening sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: One for the people of God, one for all the Gentiles
questions.explanation: Verse 10 speaks of two lots representing God's sovereign distinction between His people and the nations, resonating with Deuteronomy 32:8, Romans 11:25-26, Ephesians 2:11-22, and Revelation 15:4.

questions.question: When did the two lots come according to Esther 10:11, and what does this imply about divine judgment?
options: At the hour, time, and day of judgment before God among all nations
At the coronation of King Ahasuerus only
During the feast of Purim alone
At an unknown time with no significance
questions.correctAnswer: At the hour, time, and day of judgment before God among all nations
questions.explanation: Esther 10:11 emphasizes God's perfect timing in judgment, a theme echoed in Ecclesiastes 3:1, Acts 17:31, 2 Peter 3:9, and Revelation 20:11-15.

questions.question: What does God do for His people according to Esther 10:12?
options: Remembers them and justifies His inheritance
questions.correctAnswer: Remembers them and justifies His inheritance
questions.explanation: Verse 12 affirms God's remembrance and justification of His people, reflecting His covenant faithfulness, consistent with Psalm 98:3, Isaiah 43:1, Romans 8:33, and Hebrews 10:14.

questions.question: What is the significance of the days mentioned in Esther 10:13 for the people of God?
options: They are days of assembly, joy, and gladness before God forever
They are days of fasting and mourning only
They are ordinary days with no special meaning
They are days reserved for war and conquest
questions.correctAnswer: They are days of assembly, joy, and gladness before God forever
questions.explanation: Esther 10:13 describes days set for joy and gladness, which points to God's redemptive celebration, parallel to Leviticus 23:40, Nehemiah 8:10, Psalm 118:24, and Luke 15:7.

questions.question: According to Esther 10:2, where are the acts of the king’s power and the greatness of Mordecai recorded?
options: In the book of the chronicles of the kings of Media and Persia
In the scrolls of the prophets
In the temple records of Jerusalem
In the writings of Esther alone
questions.correctAnswer: In the book of the chronicles of the kings of Media and Persia
questions.explanation: Verse 2 notes the royal chronicles as the record of God's providential acts, aligning with Daniel 6:1-28, 2 Chronicles 36:22-23, Ezra 6:1-5, and Luke 1:1-4.

questions.question: In Esther 10:8, who are identified as the nations assembled to destroy the Jews?
options: The nations assembled to destroy the name of the Jews
questions.correctAnswer: The nations assembled to destroy the name of the Jews
questions.explanation: Verse 8 highlights hostile nations opposing God's people, reflecting the biblical theme of spiritual conflict found in Genesis 12:3, Psalm 83:4, John 15:18, and Ephesians 6:12.

questions.question: What does Mordecai recall in Esther 10:5 that confirms God's providence?
options: A dream concerning these matters that did not fail
A prophecy from the prophets of Israel
A vision given to the king alone
questions.correctAnswer: A dream concerning these matters that did not fail
questions.explanation: Esther 10:5 refers to a dream that came to pass, affirming God's revelation through dreams, consistent with Genesis 37:5-11, Daniel 2:1-49, Matthew 1:20, and Acts 2:17.

questions.question: How does Esther 10:9 describe the relationship between Israel and God in context of salvation?
options: Israel cried to God and were saved; the Lord delivered them from all evils
Israel was left to suffer without help
God was indifferent to Israel's cries
Israel saved themselves by their own strength
questions.correctAnswer: Israel cried to God and were saved; the Lord delivered them from all evils
questions.explanation: Verse 9 emphasizes God's saving power and deliverance, consistent with Exodus 15:2, Psalm 34:17, Isaiah 43:2, and Romans 10:13.

questions.question: Esther 10:13 mentions the month of Adar and specific days. What is their significance?
options: Days of assembly, joy, and gladness before God forever among His people
questions.correctAnswer: Days of assembly, joy, and gladness before God forever among His people
questions.explanation: The passage marks these days as perpetual celebrations of deliverance, correlating with Leviticus 23:4-8, Nehemiah 8:9-12, Psalm 100:1-5, and Philippians 4:4.
